gnat.representation
Class Context

java.lang.Object
  gnat.representation.Context

public class Context
extends java.lang.Object

Context for NEI processing.
This context keeps track of recognized entities and their identification status.

Provides several methods to sort/print/store predicted results in various formats.

Nested Class Summary
static class Context.IdentifiedGeneIdComparator
          A comparator to compare identified genes by their text ID and gene ID (disregards gene names).
static class Context.IdentifiedGeneNameComparator
          A comparator to compare identified genes by their text ID, gene name, and gene ID.
static class Context.RecognizedEntityComparator
          A comparator to compare entities by their text range begin index.

private  java.util.Map<RecognizedEntity,IdentificationStatus> identificationStatusMap
          Maps entities that have been recognized to their identification status, that is, whether they have been identified already, and/or which candidate ID(s) remain.
private  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String>> pmid2allNames
          A mapping from PubMed IDs to gene names contained in each article.

getIdentifiedGeneList

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getIdentifiedGeneList()
Returns a list of strings that represent the result in BioCreative GN format: a tab-separated list with columns for text ID (PubMed ID), gene ID (EntrezGene), gene name as found in the text, a confidence score, start position, and end position.

Returns:

getIdentifiedGeneList_SortedByTextAndId

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getIdentifiedGeneList_SortedByTextAndId()
Returns a list of strings that represent the result in TSV format: a tab-separated list with columns for text ID (PubMed ID), gene ID (EntrezGene), gene name(s) as found in the text, a confidence score, and species.

This list is sorted by text ID and gene ID; thus all duplicate gene IDs (per text) are removed, even if they occur at different positions in the text.

Returns:
See Also:
#getIdentifiedGeneListInBioCreativeFormat()

writeIdentifiedGeneList_SortedByPosition

                                              throws java.io.IOException
Writes all currently identified genes in this context to a file; the file will be overwritten if it exists already.

                                               throws java.io.IOException
Appends all currently identified genes in this context to a file of identified genes. The file will be created if it does not exist yet.

toIdentifiedGeneList_SortedByPosition

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> toIdentifiedGeneList_SortedByPosition()


Note: currently sorts by start position, even across texts! So this is useful only if results for a single text are involved.

Returns:
